metadata.title: CVE-2021-39657 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In ufshcd_eh_device_reset_handler of ufshcd.c, there is a possible out ofbounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to localinformation disclosure with System execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-194696049References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39657` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-204.236
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1089.98
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1123.137
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1098.105~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1112.124~16.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1097.110~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-204.236').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1089.98').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.137').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.105~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1112.124~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1097.110~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1069.77~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
